alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 4:38PM MST until July 19 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 436 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area, along State Route 260 in the Christopher Creek area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hunter Creek, Christopher Creek, Sharp Creek Campground, Christopher Creek Campground and Bear Flat. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 270 and 279. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Christopher Creek, Hunter Creek, Haigler Creek, Spring Creek, Sharp Creek and Tonto Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
